item.title: New Type of Monothalamea is Made of More Than 40 Living Distinct Living Clades
item.description: Berlin University has unveiled a new type of monothalamea, a single-celled organism, that is made up of more than 40 distinct living clades. The discovery was made by a team of researchers led by Dr. Maria Schmidt, who spent the last decade studying various single-celled organisms in an effort to better understand their evolution. The new species, which has not yet been named, was discovered in the depths of the Pacific Ocean.
